00009  : Socket(ccp)

00022 int TCPSocket::connectTo( Address& addr )
00023 {
00024    return connect( sockfd_, addr.getAddr(), addr.getLen() );
00025 }
00026 
00027 
00028 int TCPSocket::listenOn( Address& addr )
00029 {
00030    int err = 0;
00031    SysErrIf( (err=bind(sockfd_, addr.getAddr(), addr.getLen() )) == -1 );   
00032    SysErrIf( (err=listen(sockfd_, 5)) == -1 );
00033    
00034    // Get values from the kernel for what was assigned during the bind
00035    socklen_t len = addr.getLen();
00036    SysErrIf( getsockname(sockfd_, addr.getAddr(), &len) == -1 );
00037    return err;
00038 }
00039 
00040 
00041 Socket* TCPSocket::accept(const char* name) {
00042    int err = 0;
00043    sockaddr_in saddr;
00044    socklen_t len = sizeof(saddr);
00045    SysErrIf( (err=::accept(sockfd_, (sockaddr*) &saddr, &len )) == -1 );
00046    // make an Socket out of client
00047    return new TCPSocket( name, err );
00048 }

00056 int TCPSocket::send( const Buffer& buf )
00057 {
00058    return ::send(sockfd_, buf.buf, buf.len, 0);
00059 }
00060 
00061 
00065 ntee::Buffer* TCPSocket::recv()
00066 {
00067    int err = 0;
00068    char* buf = (char*) malloc(10000);
00069 std::cerr << "recieving data from fd=" << sockfd_ << "\n";
00070    SysErrIf( (err=::recv(sockfd_,buf,10000,0)) == -1 );
00071    if ( err == 0 ) return 0;
00072    
00073    Buffer* pB = new Buffer();
00074    pB->len = err;
00075    pB->buf = buf;
00076    return pB;
00077 }

00081 {
00082    return 1;
00083 }

00086 int TCPSocket::close() {
00087    return ::close(sockfd_);
00088 }
